page.title: 07School - East Brent
page.content: East Brent C.E.V.C. First School was built in 1841 as a National School and enlarged in 1857. It is built of brick with a slate roof and is now a listed building. At one time, 100 pupils were taught in this building. Nowadays the school has 57 pupils and 2 teachers. The children are 4 - 9 years and later transfer to Hugh Sexey's Middle School at Blackford. They are taught in one mobile unit and one wooden building. There is a large playground. The school is built between the church and Brent Knoll. Footpaths to Brent Knoll run through the playground. There is a large pond by the hall which is used as a conservation area.
